intro: Hablitzia, commonly known as the "Mexican flame tree," is a tropical plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Hablitzia thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
